intro: Desmos chinensis var. jarawae, commonly known as the Jarawa desmos, is a climbing shrub native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
